revised_title: Meteorological Observations Using Kites: Upper Air Temperature and Humidity Studies off the West Coast of Scotland
tldr: This study presents the results of the first organized attempt to obtain automatic records of temperature and humidity in the upper air of the British Isles using kites. The authors conducted forty kite ascents, raising instruments to an average height of 5,900 feet, and analyzed the data to understand temperature gradients, weather patterns, and the effects of depressions on air temperature.
